definition: (idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
outstanding/particularly, especially/a fault/to express discontentment against

sentences.english: Complain not, no matter how bleak it seems.
sentences.chinese: 不要怨天尤人，無論現在看來是怎麼地黯淡淒涼。

sentences.english: Damn those poor Kenyans. If only they weren't such pessimistic sourpusses.
sentences.chinese: 該死的肯亞窮人，你們別那麼怨天尤人就好了。

sentences.english: Gains and losses at work slowly dim view of the heart, no longer complain of.
sentences.chinese: 在工作中得失心慢慢的看淡了，也不再怨天尤人了。

sentences.english: Why do people blame everything but themselves for their unhappiness?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼人們會因爲不開心而怨天尤人？

sentences.english: They are digging their own graves, and they have no right to blame fate or other people.
sentences.chinese: 自家掘坑自家埋，怨天尤人全是錯誤的。

sentences.english: Life is too short to waste it in hating someone or resenting something.
sentences.chinese: 生命很短暫，所以不要浪費時間怨天尤人。

sentences.english: And we've all chosen to do this with our lives.
sentences.chinese: 所以，是對我們的生活怨天尤人的好。

sentences.english: They complained all the time about their bad luck and not being favored by chances.
sentences.chinese: 他們怨天尤人，大嘆生不逢時，缺少機遇。

sentences.english: A lot of older people are crotchety because they've been complaining all their lives.
sentences.chinese: 很多老年人脾氣暴躁，因爲他們一輩子都在怨天尤人。

sentences.english: Winners do not play “helpless”, nor do they play the blaming game.
sentences.chinese: 勝利者既不扮“可憐人”，也不上演怨天尤人。

sentences.english: They did not waste energy on anger or self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有浪費精力去怨天尤人或者顧影自憐。

sentences.english: The whining, murmuring pang never does anybody any good.
sentences.chinese: 在苦難中怨天尤人永遠不會給別人帶來任何益處。

sentences.english: We have no cause for complaint.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有理由怨天尤人。

definition: to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
lit. looking at one's shadow and feeling sorry for oneself (idiom)/fig. alone and dejected
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
